it.hackcaffebabe.ioutil.file

Class IOSerializable

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.hackcaffebabe.ioutil.file.IOSerializable

  • public final class IOSerializable
extends java.lang.Object
    This class facilitates the Input/Output for serialization operations.
    For example use this code to store an Integer object on the path "sys/foo/int/int.ser":
    
 Integer i = new Integer( 42 );
 IOSerializable.save( i, new File( "sys/foo/int/int.ser" ) );
    And finally use this to retrieve information from serialized object ( for example the previous Integer object ): 
    
 Integer serializedObject = IOSerializable.load( Integer.class, new File( "sys/foo/int/int.ser" ) );

    • Method Detail

      • save

        public static void save(java.io.Serializable serializableFile,
                        java.io.File onFile)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        java.io.IOException
        This method serialize an object on a File given.
        All file specification are set by File argument ( name, extension, path... ).
        The file could not be exists, it will be created when the object will be written on it, but the path MUST be exists. Otherwise will be throw a FileNotFoundException.
        Parameters:
        serializableFile - Object the object to serialize on file.
        onFile - File the file to store on disk the serialized object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if serializedObject is null or onFile is null or a directory.
        java.io.IOException - if there are issues to store the file or the path of file is not valid. In this case will be throw a FileNotFoundException.

      • load

        public static <T> T load(java.lang.Class<T> classToCast,
                         java.io.File fromFile)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method load an serialized object from file.
        The file MUST be exists, otherwise will be throw a FileNotFoundException.
        Parameters:
        classToCast - Class the class to cast the read object.
        fromFile - File the file to read the serialized object.
        Returns:
        object of class T, instance of class given by argument classToCast.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if class to cast not implements Serializable.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument are null or empty.
        java.io.IOException - if method can not read file.
